div.p:
Guthrie Public Schools Spring Semester 2020
Frequently Asked Questions
How will grades be calculated? Students will receive the grades they earned through March 12 th. Will students be allowed to make up missed work, make corrections or anything to raise their current grade? High School students or Junior High Algebra I students may raise their grade by up to 10 percent through one of two methods. They have the . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about GPS COVID-19 FAQ

div.p: March 29, 2020 The past few days have been something we could have never imagined only a couple of months ago. On Wednesday, March 25th, the State Board of Education ordered all school buildings to be closed for the remainder of the school year. The board further ordered that each district develop a framework for distance learning. State Superintendent Joy Hofmeister, made it very clear how this looks will vary . . .

h3.a: Sack Lunches for ages 1 through 18 available starting March 23rd

div.p: This afternoon, the Oklahoma State Board of Education ordered all public schools to be closed until at least April 6th in response to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. This closure will include all extra-curricular contests and practices. Beginning on March 23rd, sack lunches will be available for curbside pickup Monday through Friday from 11:00 a.m. until 12:00 p.m. in the parking lots of Central and Cotteral Elementary. These lunches will . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Sack Lunches for ages 1 through 18 available starting March 23rd

div.p: Nominated for Student of the Month by Shana Fields was Kalie King, a 6th grader at Guthrie Upper Elementary. Blake Wimsey from Foundation Insurance presented Kaliewith a $65 gift card to Stacy's Place. . . .

Guthrie Public Schools would like to congratulate Melanie Ball for being named the 2019-2020 Teacher of the Year!

h3.a: Low Cost Internet For Households That Qualify for Free or Reduced Meals

div.p:
Both Cox Communications and AT&T are providing low cost internet to households with K-12 children who are eligible for the National School Lunch Program, SNAP, and/or TANF; who receive Tenant-Based Vouchers, Project-Based Vouchers or Section 8 Project-Based Rental Assistance. Please follow the links below to learn more.
http://www.connect2compete.org/cox . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Low Cost Internet For Households That Qualify for Free or Reduced Meals

div.p:
Guthrie Public Schools is expanding our virtual educational offerings for students in grades 7-12 for the 2019-2020 school year. Students who apply and are accepted into the program will be able to take up to 100 percent of their courses online. Students will also have the option to take one elective course like Athletics, Band, Vocal, or other Fine Arts and be able to compete as a Bluejay!
. . .
